intro: Woodsia taigischensis, commonly known as the Siberian wood fern, is a rare and endemic species found primarily in the taiga regions of Siberia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that are typically bipinnate. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, often growing in shaded forest floors or along stream banks. Its rhizomes are short and creeping, allowing it to spread slowly through vegetative propagation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
